title: Everyday English Course 62
description: Improve your English comprehension skills through short everyday conversations and situational dialogues.

sections.title: Section 1: English Practice
sections.description: Learn to understand and respond to basic English dialogues used in daily situations.

answerOptions: To help him prepare for the conference.
To see if he is ready for the coming conference.
To tell him something about the conference.
instances.correctAnswer: To help him prepare for the conference.

variables.a: What's purpose of the woman's visit to the man?

answerOptions: The next bus is coming soon.
The bus will wait a few minutes at thestop.
There are only two or three passengers waiting for the bus.
instances.correctAnswer: The next bus is coming soon.

variables.a: What does the woman mean?

answerOptions: He was late for school on the first day.
He was the first person she met at school.
instances.correctAnswer: He was late for school on the first day.

variables.a: Why did the woman remember James so well?

answerOptions: Just make use of whatever information is available.
Put more effort into preparing for the presentation.
Find more relevant information for their work.
instances.correctAnswer: Just make use of whatever information is available.

variables.a: What does the man suggest they do?

answerOptions: She asked the man to call Jack late at night.
Jack gets home late in the evening.
It would be better to call another time.
instances.correctAnswer: It would be better to call another time.

variables.a: What does the woman imply?

answerOptions: He is glad to help the woman.
He doesn't like to help the woman.
He is too busy to help the woman these days.
instances.correctAnswer: He is too busy to help the woman these days.

variables.a: What does the man mean?

questionTemplates.text_en:
M: Hi, Jenny, are you still up for next Saturday's get-together?
W: Yeah. What's the latest?
M: We're meeting at 6 outside Harold's Fish and Chip shop. Then, once we're all together, we'll go to the Skylight.
{a}
questionTemplates.text_ru:
M: Hi, Jenny, are you still up for next Saturday's get-together?
W: Yeah. What's the latest?
M: We're meeting at 6 outside Harold's Fish and Chip shop. Then, once we're all together, we'll go to the Skylight.
{a}
questionTemplates.text_kz:
M: Hi, Jenny, are you still up for next Saturday's get-together?
W: Yeah. What's the latest?
M: We're meeting at 6 outside Harold's Fish and Chip shop. Then, once we're all together, we'll go to the Skylight.
{a}

variables.a: What are they going to do first?

answerOptions: He will study the other 20 lessons.
He will go over the 13 lessons.

variables.a: What will the man do at the weekend?
What are the speakers mainly talking about?

questionTemplates.text_en:
W: Can I go out with friends, Dad?
M: Yes, Carol, but you can't go out in those clothes. It's freezing today.
W: Okay, Dad. I'll wear something warmer.
{a}

M: Yes, Carol, but you can't go out in those clothes. It's freezing today.

variables.a: What does Carol's father ask her to do?

sections.title: Section 2: English Practice
sections.description: Learn to understand and respond to basic English dialogues used in daily situations.

variables.a: What does the woman forget to do?

questionTemplates.text_en:
M: Would you like to go dancing with me this evening?
W: I'd love to. But I'm just getting over the flu.
M: Well, why don't we do something else, like go to a movie?
W: Oh, no, thanks. Really, I'm still too weak for anything.
{a}
questionTemplates.text_ru:

W: I'd love to. But I'm just getting over the flu.
M: Well, why don't we do something else, like go to a movie?
W: Oh, no, thanks. Really, I'm still too weak for anything.
{a}
questionTemplates.text_kz:

{a}

answerOptions: She doesn't like going to the movies
She has to work hard for two weeks
She is recovering from an illness
instances.correctAnswer: She is recovering from an illness

variables.a: Why does the woman reject the man's invitation?

questionTemplates.text_en:
M: What do you enjoy about holidays and special occasions?
W: I enjoy seeing family and friends, and I enjoy inviting people to my home. What about you?
M: I enjoy everything about holidays.
{a}

M: I enjoy everything about holidays.

{a}

answerOptions: How to spend their next holidays.
What they enjoy doing during holidays.
instances.correctAnswer: What they enjoy doing during holidays.

variables.a: What are the speakers talking about?

questionTemplates.text_en:
W: Good morning, can I help you?
M: Yes, I'd like to know something about the weather in Arizona in the coming week.
W: Well, it will be fairly hot and there will be much rain.
M: I see. Thanks very much for your help.
{a}
questionTemplates.text_ru:
W: Good morning, can I help you?
M: Yes, I'd like to know something about the weather in Arizona in the coming week.
W: Well, it will be fairly hot and there will be much rain.
M: I see. Thanks very much for your help.
{a}

variables.a: What will the weather in Arizona be like in the coming week?

questionTemplates.text_en:
W: Good morning! Can I help you?
M: Yes, I'd like a quiet room on the second floor for three nights.
W: OK, this way, please.
{a}

variables.a: Where is the man?

questionTemplates.text_en:
M: Well, let's make our appointment around two o'clock this afternoon.
W: Fine. I'll come to your office either at two o'clock or earlier if I can.
M: All right. The sooner the better.
{a}

variables.a: What time does the man expect the woman to come?

answerOptions: He left it at the airport.
He left it in his friend's car.
instances.correctAnswer: He left it in his friend's car.

variables.a: What did the man say about his camera?

answerOptions: The movie concerns too much about money.
He wants to see the film again.

variables.a: How does the man feel about the movie?

sections.title: Section 3: English Practice
sections.description: Learn to understand and respond to basic English dialogues used in daily situations.

questionTemplates.text_en:
W: Why are you so upset, David?
M: My boss warned me not to spend all day communicating with my friends, but I didn't. He just didn't believe me.
W: You must have forgotten to close your hotmail's window again. You should have known better.
{a}
questionTemplates.text_ru:
W: Why are you so upset, David?
M: My boss warned me not to spend all day communicating with my friends, but I didn't. He just didn't believe me.
W: You must have forgotten to close your hotmail's window again. You should have known better.
{a}
questionTemplates.text_kz:

M: My boss warned me not to spend all day communicating with my friends, but I didn't. He just didn't believe me.
W: You must have forgotten to close your hotmail's window again. You should have known better.
{a}

answerOptions: He left his email page open.
He forgot to close the door.
instances.correctAnswer: He left his email page open.

variables.a: What does the woman think that the man did wrong?

answerOptions: Try not to hurt her shoulder.

variables.a: What does the man think Karen should do?

questionTemplates.text_en:
M: I've been worried that Richard is frozen.
W: What sounds to be a problem?
M: Well, he has trouble concentrating when getting along with other children. I was wondering there might be something on his mind. Some problem at home?
{a}

variables.a: What is the possible relationship between the two speakers?
How are they going there?

questionTemplates.text_en:
M: Excuse me, what is the time by your watch?
W: Half past nine. But it's 10 minutes slow.
M: Thanks.
{a}

variables.a: What is the correct time now?
What is the woman buying?
When does it often rain?

answerOptions: He must read a lot of books.
He can't get the books he needs.
instances.correctAnswer: He must read a lot of books.

variables.a: Why is the man worried?

answerOptions: She saw the man run out.
She thought the man's laundry was done badly.
She was sorry the man couldn't finish his laundry.
instances.correctAnswer: She was sorry the man couldn't finish his laundry.

variables.a: What does the woman mean?
Where will the woman go first after work?
